peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does it cost to get an appraisal on antiques?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Typically, formal appraisals for a single item start at about $250 to $350. Additional items will typically add incremental costs of between $25 and $100 per item. The exact amount depends on their rarity, uniqueness, and the ability to find appropriate comparable properties to appraise them.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What Appraisals Cost

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to find a reputable antique appraiser?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The best way to find an appraiser is to look for someone with expertise in your specific type of item (eg, collectibles, jewelry, sports memorabilia, etc.) and a proven track record of professional service.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Best way to find an appraiser? : r/Flipping

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I get an old item appraised?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: A really good place to go to is antique auctions, as they have specialist valuers and if you take the item to them or send photos, they will usually give you a free valuation in the hope that you will sell your goods through them. There are two types of auctions you can try.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Valuing Antiques
